cab.content: II ^^^ ^^ItiCthe Property *of Military Secret. 1031 ^From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Slate for India,5th August 1919.(Received 6th; 10.30 a.m.)10588. 5th August. No. 8G. Part I.--1, Afghan troops at Birkot are now experiencing difficulties over supplies. Wakil Khan has reported to Asmar that his men are likely to start raiding unless this is rectified.2. Governor of Jalalabad now appears to be taking more vigorous action to restrain tribesmen while peace negotiations are in progress.Part 11. 3. Raiding parties are still hovering about on Derajat border. No action beyond cutting of telegraph lines so far reported.4. No change in Zhob. Loralai-Peshin road breached by flood and will be impassable for a few clays.All communicated to Press.
